statement.p: This is a circle with radius 4.00 cm inscribed in a square with no side labeled. Round using the rules for measurements.

ol.li: What is the area of the square? \displaystyle\text{cm}^{{2}}
What is the area of the circle? \displaystyle\text{cm}^{{2}}
What is the area of the shaded section? \displaystyle\text{cm}^{{2}}

solution.p: The side length of the square is not given directly. However, because the circle is inscribed, a diameter of the circle is the same length as a side. Thus the square has side length \displaystyle{8.00}\ \text{ cm} and area \displaystyle{8.00}^{{2}}={64}\approx{64}\ \text{ cm}^{{2}}.
The area of the circle is \displaystyle\pi{\left({4.00}^{{2}}\right)}\approx{50.265482457437}\approx{50.3}\ \text{ cm}^{{2}}.
The area between them (shaded) is \displaystyle{64}-{50.265482457437}={13.734517542563}\approx{13.7}\ \text{ cm}^{{2}}.
